com.csvanefalk.keytestgen.util.transformers
Class ConjunctionNormalFormTransformer

java.lang.Object
  com.csvanefalk.keytestgen.util.transformers.AbstractTermTransformer
      com.csvanefalk.keytestgen.util.transformers.ConjunctionNormalFormTransformer
All Implemented Interfaces:
ITermTransformer
public class ConjunctionNormalFormTransformer
extends AbstractTermTransformer

This parser is used in order to put a Term into Conjunctive Normal Form.

Assume that a Literal L is either an atom p or the negation of an atom !p. A Term T is in CNF if it is a conjunction of clauses, where each clause D is a disjunction of literals: 

 L ::= p | !p
 D ::= L | L OR D
 C ::= D | D AND T

Author:
christopher

distribute

private de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term distribute(de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term firstTerm,
                                              de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term secondTerm)
Implements the DISTR routine of the CNF algorithm. It is defined as follows: 


 Pre: n1 and n2 are in CNF
 Post: DISTR(n1,n2) computes a CNF for n1 OR n2

 function DISTR(n1, n2):
 begin function
     case
         n1 is n1-1 AND n1-2 : return DISTR(n1-1,n2) AND DISTR(n1-2,n2)
         n2 is n2-1 AND n2-2 : return DISTR(n1,n2-1) AND DISTR(n1,n2-2)
         otherwise : return n1 OR n2
     end case
 end function

Parameters:
firstTerm - n1
secondTerm - n2
Returns:
the distributed term

transform

public de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term transform(de.uka.ilkd.key.logic.Term term)
                                     throws TermTransformerException
Puts a Term into Conjunctive Normal Form, using the following algorithm: 

 Pre: x is implication free and in Negation Normal Form
 Post: CNF(x) computes and equivalent CNF for(x)
 function CNF(x):
 begin function
     case
         x is a literal : return x
         x is x1 AND x2 : return CNF(x1) and CNF(x2)
         x is x1 OR x2 : return DISTR(CNF(x1) and CNF(x2))
     end case
 end function

The algorithm was taken from:

(Huth and Ryan, Logic in Computer Science, pages 60-61, 2nd Ed. Cambridge University press, 2008)

Parameters:
term - the term to transform
Returns:
the transformed term
Throws:
TermTransformerException
